travelAdvisoryComment.__text: Dig down to find and test weak layers before committing to a line.Make observations and assess conditions continually as you travel.The storm slab will require several days to settle and stabilize.

travelAdvisoryComment_asArray.__text: Dig down to find and test weak layers before committing to a line.Make observations and assess conditions continually as you travel.The storm slab will require several days to settle and stabilize.

comment.__text: Continued reactivity is quite possible from the buried February 12th surface hoar layer. The amount of snow above the weak layer is variable across the region. This layer may be particularly reactive where it coexists with a crust on solar aspects.

comment_asArray.__text: Continued reactivity is quite possible from the buried February 12th surface hoar layer. The amount of snow above the weak layer is variable across the region. This layer may be particularly reactive where it coexists with a crust on solar aspects.

travelAdvisoryComment.__text: Be cautious as you transition into wind affected terrain.

travelAdvisoryComment_asArray.__text: Be cautious as you transition into wind affected terrain.

comment.__text: Light amounts of new snow and moderate winds are likely to create fresh wind slabs at higher elevations. Watch for triggering in the lee of ridge crests and in gullies.

wxSynopsisComment.__text: Thursday: Light snowfall intensifying in the evening / Moderate southwest winds / Freezing level at 900mFriday: Moderate snowfall / Strong southwest winds / Freezing level at 1000mSaturday: Light snowfall / Light northwest winds / Freezing level at 700m

wxSynopsisComment_asArray.__text: Thursday: Light snowfall intensifying in the evening / Moderate southwest winds / Freezing level at 900mFriday: Moderate snowfall / Strong southwest winds / Freezing level at 1000mSaturday: Light snowfall / Light northwest winds / Freezing level at 700m

avActivityComment.__text: On Monday a size 2 skier-triggered avalanche occurred near Invermere which resulted in a fatality. The avalanche ran on a south/southeast aspect at 2700m and is thought to have failed at the February 11/12 interface. More recently, avalanche control in the region avalanches to size 3. Most of the control work involved cornice control shots which, in one case, triggered a large slab on the slope below.

avActivityComment_asArray.__text: On Monday a size 2 skier-triggered avalanche occurred near Invermere which resulted in a fatality. The avalanche ran on a south/southeast aspect at 2700m and is thought to have failed at the February 11/12 interface. More recently, avalanche control in the region avalanches to size 3. Most of the control work involved cornice control shots which, in one case, triggered a large slab on the slope below.

snowpackStructureComment.__text: Very light amounts of low density snow add to the recently developed storm slab that is between 15-60 cms across the region. The recent storm slab is expected to remain reactive where it is sitting on the weak surface hoar layer that was buried on February 12th. The recent storm slab has also been reactive on Southerly aspects where a sun crust formed during the period from February 8th-11th. Future loading may cause another cycle of natural activity, or an increased sensitivity to human triggers. There are older weak layers that are now buried down around 70-80 cms and also at about 110 cms. These layers have been less likely to trigger by skiers, but they may still be sensitive to large loads like avalanches in motion or cornice fall.

The recent storm slab is expected to remain reactive where it is sitting on the weak surface hoar layer that was buried on February 12th. Future loading may cause another cycle of natural activity, or an increased sensitivity to human triggers. There are older weak layers that are now buried down around 70-80 cms and also at about 110 cms. These layers have been less likely to trigger by skiers, but they may still be sensitive to large loads like avalanches in motion or cornice fall.

wxSynopsisComment_asArray.__text: Thursday: Light snowfall intensifying in the evening / Moderate southwest winds / Freezing level at 900mFriday: Moderate snowfall / Strong southwest winds / Freezing level at 1000mSaturday: Light snowfall / Light northwest winds / Freezing level at 700m

avActivityComment.__text: On Monday a size 2 skier-triggered avalanche occurred near Invermere which resulted in a fatality. The avalanche ran on a south/southeast aspect at 2700m and is thought to have failed at the February 11/12 interface. More recently, avalanche control in the region avalanches to size 3. Most of the control work involved cornice control shots which, in one case, triggered a large slab on the slope below.

avActivityComment_asArray.__text: On Monday a size 2 skier-triggered avalanche occurred near Invermere which resulted in a fatality. The avalanche ran on a south/southeast aspect at 2700m and is thought to have failed at the February 11/12 interface. More recently, avalanche control in the region avalanches to size 3. Most of the control work involved cornice control shots which, in one case, triggered a large slab on the slope below.

snowpackStructureComment.__text: Very light amounts of low density snow add to the recently developed storm slab that is between 15-60 cms across the region. The recent storm slab is expected to remain reactive where it is sitting on the weak surface hoar layer that was buried on February 12th. The recent storm slab has also been reactive on Southerly aspects where a sun crust formed during the period from February 8th-11th. Future loading may cause another cycle of natural activity, or an increased sensitivity to human triggers. There are older weak layers that are now buried down around 70-80 cms and also at about 110 cms. These layers have been less likely to trigger by skiers, but they may still be sensitive to large loads like avalanches in motion or cornice fall.

Future loading may cause another cycle of natural activity, or an increased sensitivity to human triggers. There are older weak layers that are now buried down around 70-80 cms and also at about 110 cms. These layers have been less likely to trigger by skiers, but they may still be sensitive to large loads like avalanches in motion or cornice fall.

travelAdvisoryComment.__text: Dig down to find and test weak layers before committing to a line.Make observations and assess conditions continually as you travel.The storm slab will require several days to settle and stabilize.

travelAdvisoryComment_asArray.__text: Dig down to find and test weak layers before committing to a line.Make observations and assess conditions continually as you travel.The storm slab will require several days to settle and stabilize.

comment.__text: Continued reactivity is quite possible from the buried February 12th surface hoar layer. The amount of snow above the weak layer is variable across the region. This layer may be particularly reactive where it coexists with a crust on solar aspects.

comment_asArray.__text: Continued reactivity is quite possible from the buried February 12th surface hoar layer. The amount of snow above the weak layer is variable across the region. This layer may be particularly reactive where it coexists with a crust on solar aspects.

travelAdvisoryComment.__text: Be cautious as you transition into wind affected terrain.

travelAdvisoryComment_asArray.__text: Be cautious as you transition into wind affected terrain.

comment.__text: Light amounts of new snow and moderate winds are likely to create fresh wind slabs at higher elevations. Watch for triggering in the lee of ridge crests and in gullies.

comment_asArray.__text: Light amounts of new snow and moderate winds are likely to create fresh wind slabs at higher elevations. Watch for triggering in the lee of ridge crests and in gullies.

travelAdvisoryComment.__text: Be aware of the potential for large, deep avalanches due to the presence of buried surface hoar.Choose well supported terrain without convexities.
